infotexts:
Soundproof Walls [version] Opens the Soundproof Walls settings menu. Opens the Soundproof Walls welcome popup. Opens the Soundproof Walls workshop page in your browser. Opens the Soundproof Walls Configuration Guide page in your browser. Opens the Soundproof Walls Report Bugs page in your browser.
Finished loading Soundproof Walls v[version] Commands: > Open the settings menu by typing "spw".
 > Print your stats by typing "spw_stats".
 > Have a question? Open the workshop page by typing "spw_workshop" and leave a comment.
 > Found a bug? type "spw_report" to open the discussion page and make a post.
 > Learn more about the config options with "spw_help".
 > Re-open the first-time launch popup by typing "spw_welcome".
Syncing Enabled!
You are using a config uploaded to the server by [name]. Values from this config are shown in parentheses next to yours. Syncing Enabled!
Your config has been uploaded to the server and is being used by all players. Syncing Disabled!
The server has no config uploaded. You are using your local config.Looking for your config file? Default values are blue.
Custom values are yellow.
Vanilla values are white.

Looking for your config file?
You can find it at:
[path]
Edit Permission:
You are the host of this session. Changes will be uploaded to the server and used by all players. Edit Permission:
You are an admin in this session. Changes will be uploaded to the server and used by all players. Edit Permission:
You are not the host of this session. Changes will be saved locally but will not apply while the server has syncing is enabled. Edit Permission:
You are not an admin in this session. Changes will be saved locally but will not apply while the server has syncing is enabled.
Muffle Gain Reverb General Visuals
General
Enable Mod Globally toggles all features of the mod. Sync Settings Toggles the synchronization of settings between players.

If enabled, the host automatically uploads their config to the server to be shared with all players. This upload happens once at the start of a session or whenever changes are made. Players are forced to use this config regardless of their local config settings, which remain unchanged.
Effect Processing Mode How audio effects are processed. Dynamic mode is recommended.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded.
Classic Vanilla-style muffling with one muffle preset (Heavy Lowpass Frequency). Minimal resource use. Static Adds light and medium muffle presets plus optional reverb. Slightly longer load times and higher memory usage (~250 MB). Dynamic Advanced real-time effects via OpenAL. Most realistic audio with simulated reverb, distortion, and advanced muffling, at higher CPU cost.

Note: If you're concerned about performance, enable the "Show Performance" setting in the Advanced tab to see detailed stats.
Focus Target Audio Simulate audio from the perspective of the current camera target (i.e., you hear what the turret hears). Realistic Sound Falloff Calculates volume falloff using the sound's path to the listener. If disabled, simple straight-line (Euclidean) distance is used instead. Sound Range Master Global range multiplier for all non-looping sounds.

Note: Stacks multiplicatively with the sound-specific range multiplier assigned by the "Custom Sounds" list in the Advanced tab. Looping Sound Range Master Global range multiplier for all looping sounds.

Note: Stacks multiplicatively with the sound-specific range multiplier assigned by the "Custom Sounds" list in the Advanced tab.
Dynamic Mode
Sound Occlusion Muffles sounds that don't have a direct line of sight to the player's ears due to walls. Max Occlusions How many layers of walls a sound can be occluded by.

Note: Limiting occlusion may result in an audibly more consistent muffle when faced with unusual wall configurations. Setting this value to zero disables the limit.
Over-Muffle Dynamically reduces the volume of sounds near and above the maximum effective muffle strength of 1.0.
Muffle Strength Master The overall strength of the dynamic muffle effect.
Over-Muffle Strength How much influence high muffle values have on reducing sound volume.
Enable Reverb Toggles the indoor and outdoor reverb effects. If enabled, sounds dynamically reverberate based on the size and combined audio amplitude of their environment (i.e., echos are stronger in larger and quieter spaces). Dynamic Reverb Area Calculates reverb using air area when above water, or water area when submerged. If disabled, uses the area of both. Minimum Reverb Area The minimum combined area of connected rooms around the listener required for reverberation to be applied. Reverb Area Scale Scales the effective area of the current indoor environment. Larger values increase decay time and delay of reflections, making the space sound bigger. Wet Room Reverb Scale Multiplies the effective area of ballast tanks and airlocks when the listener is inside them, making these rooms sound larger and more reverberant. Indoor Reverb Strength The base gain of the reverb effect when inside a hull. Outdoor Reverb Strength The base gain of the reverb effect when outside. Indoor Reverb Threshold The minimum sound amplitude required for a sound to produce reverb when the listener is indoors. Outdoor Reverb Threshold The minimum sound amplitude required for a sound to produce reverb when the listener is outside.
Unsubmerged Distortion Submerged Distortion
Enable Unsubmerged Distortion Enable Submerged Distortion If the listener is not submerged, applies the unsubmerged distortion effect to sounds referenced in the "Custom Sounds" list (Advanced tab) with distortion set to true. If the listener is submerged, applies the submerged distortion effect to sounds referenced in the "Custom Sounds" list (Advanced tab) with distortion set to true. Distortion Muffle Requirement The maximum muffle strength a sound can have before its distortion is disabled. Distortion Gain The volume of the distortion. Distortion Edge The harshness of the distortion. A higher value results in a more intense effect. Distortion Frequency The EQ center of the distortion. Frequencies near this value will be affected more by the effect. Distortion Lowpass Frequency A lowpass filter is applied to the distorted signal in post. This is the corner frequency used by that lowpass filter.
Experimental
Cleanup Unused Buffers Load sounds without their vanilla muffle buffer to save ~100MB of memory over vanilla. Disabled by default due to concerns of potential compatibility issues with other mods that interact with sound objects on a low level. However, in the vast majority of cases, this setting is a free boost.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded.
Static Mode Heavy Lowpass Frequency The corner frequency used to muffle sounds that are heavily obstructed. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.

Note: Does not apply to voice chat. See the lowpass frequency sliders in the Voice tab.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded. Medium Lowpass Frequency The corner frequency used to muffle sounds that are moderately obstructed. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.

Note: Does not apply to voice chat. See the lowpass frequency sliders in the Voice tab.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded. Light Lowpass Frequency The corner frequency used to muffle sounds that are lightly obstructed. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.

Note: Does not apply to voice chat. See the lowpass frequency sliders in the Voice tab.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded.
Enable Reverb Buffers Load sounds with an additional buffer ran through a reverb filter. This feature only applies to non-muffled and non-looping sounds, uses ~100MB of memory (at the default duration), and may increase level loading times by a few seconds.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded. Always Reverb Loud Sounds Sounds referenced in the "Custom Sounds" list (Advanced tab) with a sidechain multiplier greater than one ignore the minimum reverb area requirement. Reverb Duration The decay time and size of the reverb effect. The value entered reflects the duration of the effect in seconds Reverb Mix (Dry/Wet) The dry/wet mix of the reverb effect. A higher value results in a more processed signal, while lower values are closer to the original sound Reverb Damping The strength of the lowpass filter applied to the reverb feedback. Minimum Reverb Area The minimum total area of the connected rooms inhabited by the listener required for non-looping non-muffled sounds to become reverberated
Voice
Talking Ragdolls Hear players speak when they are ragdolled as long as they're not stunned
Local Range The maximum range of player voices Radio Range The maximum range of player radio transmissions Local Volume The volume of local voice chat. Behaves independently of Barotrauma's voice chat volume slider Radio Volume The volume of radio voice chat. Behaves independently of Barotrauma's voice chat volume slider
Dynamic Mode Exclusive
Reverb Local Voice Requires "Simulate Reverb" to be enabled.
Allows reverb to be applied to player voices when speaking locally Reverb Radio Requires "Simulate Reverb" to be enabled.
Allows reverb to be applied to player voices heard over the radio Dynamic Muffle Strength Requires the "Dynamic" effect processing mode.
The strength of muffle effects applied to player voices
Heavy Voice Lowpass Frequency The corner frequency used to muffle player voices that are heavily muffled. Medium Voice Lowpass Frequency temp Light Voice Lowpass Frequency temp
Scream Mode
Scream Mode The range of player voices become proportional to the amplitude of their signal (i.e., yelling will transmit your voice further)
Note: for this setting to work as expected it's recommended to tweak your Barotrauma voice settings so that the volume bar has room to expand when receiving loud input Scream Mode Max Range Requires "Scream Mode" to be enabled.
The range player voices can be heard from when speaking at max amplitude Scream Mode Min Range Requires "Scream Mode" to be enabled.
The minimum range player voices can be reduced to when speaking at low amplitudes Scream Mode Release Rate Requires "Scream Mode" to be enabled.
The distance that player voices decay in range per second when their range is no longer supported by their amplitude
Drowning
Drowning Bubbles Players emit bubbles when speaking underwater without oxygen Bubbles Range The audible range of the drowning bubbles sound Bubbles Volume (Local) The volume of the drowning bubbles sound that plays locally around the drowning player Bubbles Volume (Radio) The volume of the drowning bubbles sound that plays over the radio
Radio Filter
Custom Radio Filter Run player radio transmissions through a custom filter that includes configurable compression, distortion, and noise effects Radio Bandpass Frequency The center frequency of the bandpass filter. The frequencies in this area (the size of which is controlled by the Q factor setting below) are allowed to pass through the radio Radio Bandpass Q Factor The quality factor of the radio bandpass filter. Defines how tight the filter is around its center frequency ("Radio Bandpass Frequency"). A higher value creates a more "intense" effect Radio Distortion Drive How much player voices should be amplified before distortion clipping Radio Distortion Threshold The level player voices are clipped to Radio Static The amount of static heard over the radio Radio Compression Threshold The threshold level at which radio compression is applied. Sounds below this level will not be compressed. Radio Compression Ratio The ratio by which the volume above the threshold is reduced. A higher ratio results in more compression, reducing the dynamic range of the radio signal. Post Filter Gain Boost Apply master gain adjustment to the radio filter
Muffle Muffle Diving Suits Muffle sounds by applying the "Diving Suit" obstruction when wearing a diving suit Muffle Submerged Player Muffle sounds by applying the "Water Body" obstruction when the player's head is submerged in the same body of water as the sound Muffle Submerged View Target Muffle sounds by applying the "Water Body" obstruction when your viewed target (e.g., turrets, cameras, etc) is submerged in the same body of water as the sound Muffle Water Surface Muffle sounds on the opposite side of an air-water barrier by applying the "Water Surface" obstruction Muffle Flow & Fire Paths Muffle water flow and fire sounds if they do not have a path to the listener.
Note: this feature uses a predictive system which may not be accurate in all situations because flow/fire channels are limited and have no positional data Muffle Flow Sounds Toggle the muffling of water flow sounds from all sources (submerged, eavesdropping, using hydrophones, or behind a wall) Muffle Fire Sounds Toggle the muffling of fire sounds from all sources (submerged, eavesdropping, using hydrophones, or behind a wall) Classic Lowpass Frequency The corner frequency used to muffle sounds in Classic mode. The threshold to apply this filter is configurable in the Muffle tab.

Note: Does not apply to voice chat. See the lowpass frequency sliders in the Voice tab.

Note: Changing this setting while playing may briefly freeze the game as buffers are loaded
Obstruction Muffle Strength
Water Surface The muffle strength applied when a sound crosses an air-water barrier. Stacks multiplicatively with other obstructions Water Body The muffle strength applied when a sound travels through water to reach the listener without crossing an air-water barrier (i.e., the sound starts and ends its journey in the same body of water). Stacks multiplicatively with other obstructions Thick Wall The muffle strength applied when a sound passes through a wall normally. Stacks multiplicatively with other obstructions Thin Wall The muffle strength applied when a sound pierces through a wall (e.g., propagation). Stacks multiplicatively with other obstructions Thick Door The muffle strength applied when a sound passes through a door normally. Stacks multiplicatively with other obstructions Thin Door The muffle strength applied when a sound pierces through a door (e.g., eavesdropping). Stacks multiplicatively with other obstructions Diving Suit The muffle strength applied when a sound passes through a diving suit. Stacks multiplicatively with other obstructions Player Drowning The muffle strength applied to a player's voice when they speak while drowning. Stacks multiplicatively with other obstructions
(Classic) Muffle Threshold The minimum aggregate obstruction level required to trigger the heavy lowpass filter when using classic mode
(Static) Light Muffle Threshold The minimum aggregate obstruction level required to trigger the light lowpass filter when using static mode
(Static) Medium Muffle Threshold The minimum aggregate obstruction level required to trigger the medium lowpass filter when using static mode
(Static) Heavy Muffle Threshold The minimum aggregate obstruction level required to trigger the heavy lowpass filter when using static mode
Muffle Thresholds
Volume
Sidechaining
Enable Sidechaining Briefly ducks the volume of all sounds when a "loud sound" plays. A "loud sound" is a sound in the "Custom Sounds" list (in the Advanced tab) with a "SidechainMultiplier" greater than zero Sidechain Music Duck the volume of music tracks when a "loud sound" plays
Sidechain Intensity Master A master value applied multiplicatively to all individual sidechain multipliers in the "Custom Sounds" list Sidechain Release Master A flat amount of time added to all releases in the "Custom Sounds" list Sidechain Release Curve The exponent used to calculate the shape of the sidechain release curve. Values below one start slowly and decay more sharply towards the end. Values above one drop quickly and flatten out towards the end Sidechain Muffle Power How strongly the sidechain effect responds to a sound’s muffle strength. Higher values make heavily muffled sounds reduce the sidechain more aggressively. Sidechain Music Strength The intensity of the sidechain effect on music
Muffled Sound Volume Volume of fully muffled non-looping sounds. Blends with "Unmuffled Sound Volume" based on active obstructions (e.g., at 0.75 muffle strength, this is 75% applied) Unmuffled Sound Volume Volume of unmuffled non-looping sounds. Blends with "Muffled Sound Volume" based on muffle strength Muffled Voice Volume Volume of fully muffled player voices. Blends with "Unmuffled Voice Volume" based on muffle strength (e.g., at 0.75 muffle strength, this is 75% applied)" Unmuffled Voice Volume Volume of unmuffled player voices. Blends with "Muffled Voice volume" based on muffle strength Muffled Looping Volume Volume of fully muffled looping sounds. A looping sound is any sound that automatically repeats itself (e.g., the ventilation, reactor, or engine sounds). Blends with "Unmuffled Looping Volume" based on muffle strength (e.g., at 0.75 muffle strength, this is 75% applied) Unmuffled Looping Volume Volume of unmuffled looping sounds. A looping sound is any sound that automatically repeats itself. Blends with "Muffled Looping Volume" based on muffle strength Submerged Together Volume Volume of sounds submerged in the same body of water as the listener. Stacks multiplicatively with other volume multipliers Flow Sound Volume The volume of flowing water caused by leaks in the submarine Fire Sound Volume The volume of fires Vanilla Exosuit Volume The volume of the vanilla exosuit movement sound Component Sound Distance Falloff Start The percentage of a looping component sound's max range where its volume starts dropping off Min Distance Falloff Volume The minimum gain a sound can reach from distance falloff using the "Accurate Distance Attenuation" model (setting in the General tab)"
Eavesdropping Eavesdropping Enabled Toggles the player's ability to eavesdrop Muffle Eavesdropped Sounds Muffle sounds heard via eavesdropping by applying the "Thin Door" obstruction Eavesdropping Transition Smoothly transition audio between hulls when eavesdropping Eavesdropping Ducks Radio Lower the volume of radio communications while eavesdropping
Eavesdropping Bind Change what button is held to eavesdrop.
This setting is not synced with other players
Eavesdropped Sound Volume The volume of sounds heard via eavesdropping Eavesdropped Voice Volume The volume of player voices heard via eavesdropping Eavesdropped Sound Pitch The pitch of sounds heard via eavesdropping. Does not apply to player voices Eavesdropping Max Distance The maximum distance the player's head can be from a door while eavesdropping Eavesdropping Transition Duration The amount of seconds that the eavesdropping fade transition takes Eavesdropping Threshold The percentage of the fade transition that must play before the player starts hearing sounds on the opposite side of the door
Show All Sounds Apply the glow effect to sounds without a path to the eavesdropped area. Sounds in the listener's hull are still ignored Glow Max Size The maximum size of the glow effect. Helpful for limiting the size of the effect on longer range sounds Glow Size Multiplier The size of the glow effect relative to the range of the sound Glow Opacity The strength of the glow effect that emits from eavesdropped sounds Glow Fade Curve The exponent used to calculate the shape of the sprite fadeout curve. Values below one start slowly and decay more sharply towards the end. Values above one drop quickly and flatten out towards the end Eavesdropping Camera Zoom How far the camera should zoom in when eavesdropping Vignette Opacity The strength of the vignette effect around the edges of the screen when eavesdropping
Hydrophones Hydrophone Switch Enabled Toggles the hydrophone feature by adding or removing the terminal switch (requires restarting the round) Movement Sounds Play directional water movement sounds through the hydrophones for nearby creatures Hydrophone Legacy Switch Use the old hydrophone switch logic (switch is turned off when using active sonar) Hear Engines Hear submarine engines through the hydrophones Hear Into Structures Pick up audio from other submarines or outposts. Sounds in these structures receive the "Thin Wall" obstruction Muffle Own Sub Muffle sounds coming from within your own structure. Apply a "Water Surface" obstruction Hydrophone Range The range of underwater movement sounds and the additional range added to all sounds outside the submarine when using the hydrophones Hydrophone Volume The volume of audio heard through the hydrophones Hydrophone Pitch The pitch of audio heard through the hydrophones. Does not apply to player voices Hydrophone Ambience Volume The volume of the ambience track that plays when listening to the hydrophones Hydrophone Movement Volume The volume of the water sloshing sound caused by moving entites in the water
Visual Feedback Enable red highlights on the sonar UI that visually represent the direction, size, and implied distance of sounds in the water. Distance can be implied based on the range of the sound and the width of the highlighted sector Disable Passive Sonar Stop drawing sonar blips when monitoring the hydrophones. Sonar blips are what visually display the environment Disable Sub Outline Stop drawing the outline of the submarine and its docking hatches when monitoring the hydrophones Visual Feedback Size How thick the visual sectors should be Visual Feedback Opacity The transparency of the visual feedback effect Visual Feedback Fade Duration How many seconds it takes for each sector to fade out
Simulate Reverb Enable a unique reverb preset for hydrophones Reverb Strength The target gain for hydrophone reverb
Distort Hydrophones Applies a distortion effect to sounds heard through the hydrophones Distortion Gain The overall volume of the hydrophone distortion effect Distortion Edge The harshness of the hydrophone distortion effect. A higher value results in more high-frequency harmonics
Bandpass Hydrophones Applies a bandpass filter to sounds heard through the hydrophones. A bandpass filter cuts high and low frequencies, leaving only the middle. This creates a radio-like sound Bandpass High Frequency Gain The volume of high frequencies in the hydrophone bandpass filter Bandpass Low Frequency Gain The volume of low frequencies in the hydrophone bandpass filter
Advanced
Muffle Ignored Sounds Sounds in this list will never be obstructed by using the hydrophones
Visual Feedback Ignored Sounds Sounds in this list will never be drawn when monitoring hydrophones
Ambience Disable White Noise Disables the white noise ambient biome loops
Track-Specific Water Ambience "In" Volume Master volume multiplier for the ambience track that plays inside (it also plays when outside on top of the "outside" track) Water Ambience "Out" Volume Master volume multiplier for the ambience track that plays outside Water Ambience "Moving" Volume Master volume multiplier for the ambience track that plays when the submarine or player is moving through water
Environment-Specific Unsubmerged Suit Water Ambience Volume
Unsubmerged No Suit Water Ambience Volume
Submerged Suit Water Ambience Volume
Submerged No Suit Water Ambience Volume
Water Ambience Transition Speed The speed at which the water ambience transitions between volume presets
Pitch Enable Pitch Globally toggles all pitch effects. May be helpful as a quick fix for weird pitch interactions with sounds from other mods Pitch Status Effect Sounds Toggles pitching for sounds played by XML status effects Pitch With Distance Dynamically lower the pitch of non-looping sounds based on their distance ratio and muffle strength. Stacks additively with other pitch effects Diving Suit Pitch The pitch of sounds when wearing a diving suit. Stacks additively with other pitch effects Submerged Pitch The pitch of sounds when the listener is submerged. Stacks additively with other pitch effects Muffled Sound Pitch Pitch of fully muffled non-looping sounds. Blends with "Unmuffled Sound Pitch" based on active obstructions. Stacks additively with other pitch effects Unmuffled Sound Pitch Pitch of unmuffled non-looping sounds. Blends with "Muffled Sound Pitch" based on active obstructions. Stacks additively with other pitch effects Muffled Looping Sound Pitch The pitch of muffled looping sounds (e.g. vents, reactor, engine, etc) Unmuffled Looping Sound Pitch The pitch of normal component sounds. Not recommended. Just for fun Muffled Voice Pitch Not recommended. Just for fun Unmuffled Voice Pitch Not recommended. Just for fun
Advanced
Show Performance Display detailed performance information for Soundproof Walls.
This setting is not synced with other players
Show Playing Sounds Display all actively playing sounds registered by Soundproof Walls.
This setting is not synced with other players
Show Channel Info Display the gain, pitch, range, distance, muffle, and obstructions for all actively playing sounds. If "Show Playing Sounds" is disabled this information is logged in the Barotrauma console.
This setting is not synced with other players
Hide Menu Button Remove the "Soundproof Walls" button from the pause menu. The Soundproof Walls settings menu can still be opened by typing "spw" in the console.
This setting is not synced with other players
Remember Menu Position Opens the menu at the last scroll position and tab visited.
This setting is not synced with other players
Max Playing Sounds How many sounds can be playing at the same time. Higher values may impact performance
Max Simultaneous Instances How many instances of the same sound can be playing at the same time. Higher values may impact performance
Update Intervals Update Non-Looping Sounds This allows for non-looping sounds to update their volume, muffle, and other effects, while playing. This is something the vanilla game only does for looping sounds. Disabling this setting may improve performance Non-Looping Sound Update Interval Requires "Update Non-Looping Sounds" to be enabled.
The amount of time between each obstruction and dynamic effects update for non-looping sounds. Volume and pitch values are still updated every tick. Increasing this value may improve performance OpenAL Effects Update Interval The amount of time between each effect parameter update for OpenAL effects. Only relevant when using Dynamic mode Voice Update Interval The amount of time between each obstruction and dynamic effects update for player voices. Volume and pitch values are still updated every tick. Increasing this value may improve performance Component Sound Update Interval The amount of time between each obstruction and dynamic effects update for looping component sounds (e.g., vents, reactor, engine). Volume and pitch values are still updated every tick. Increasing this value may improve performance Status Effect Sound Update Interval The amount of time between each obstruction and dynamic effects update for looping status effect sounds (e.g., sounds from afflictions). Volume and pitch values are still updated every tick. Increasing this value may improve performance
Transitions Disable Vanilla Fade Out Disables the vanilla "FadeOutAndDispose" method, which can cause sounds to get stuck looping. The tradeoff for this stability is less smooth audio cutoffs. Gain Transition Speed How much a sound's volume can change per second. For example, a value of 5 means it would take 0.2 seconds for a full volume sound to reach silence. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions. Pitch Transition Speed How much a sound's pitch can change per second. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions. Reverb Strength Transition Speed (Inside) How much the inside reverb effect's gain can change per second. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions. Reverb Strength Transition Speed (Hydrophones) How much the hydrophone reverb effect's gain can change per second. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions. Muffle Transition Speed How much the Dynamic mode's muffle effect can change per second. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions.
Note: this feature can produce audible pops when enabled, which probably won't be fixed until Barotrauma updates its OpenAL Soft version Flow & Fire Muffle Transition Speed How much the Dynamic mode's muffle effect can change per second, specifically for water flow and fire sounds. A value of zero disables this feature for instant transitions.
Note: this feature can produce audible pops when enabled, which probably won't be fixed until Barotrauma updates its OpenAL Soft version.
Sound Pathfinding Traverse Water Ducts Allow sounds to pass through open water ducts unobstructed Flow Sounds Traverse Water Ducts Requires "Muffle Flow & Fire Paths" to be enabled.
Allow the estimation of a flow sound's path to pass through open water ducts unobstructed Open Door Threshold How open a door, hatch, or duct must be for sound to pass through unobstructed. A value of zero allows sounds to pass through fully closed doors unobstructed Open Wall Threshold How open a gap in a wall must be for sound to pass through unobstructed. Sound Propagation Range The maximum distance that a sound in the "Wall Propagating Sounds" list can search for a nearby hull to propagate into
Character AI AI Sound Range Singleplayer only.
Changes the distance that AI can hear items and characters AI Sight Range Singleplayer only.
Changes the distance that AI can see items and characters. This setting isn't sound related but it goes hand in hand with AI Sound Range
Sound Rules
Custom Sounds Apply custom values and effects to specific sounds.

"Keyword": Part of the target sound's file name. Case insensitive.

"GainMult": Volume multiplier. Stacks additively with other volume multipliers.

"RangeMult": Range multiplier. Stacks multiplicatively with other range multipliers.

"SidechainMult": The volume that other sounds are reduced by when this sound plays.

"SidechainRelease": The duration that the volume reduction lasts for.

"Distortion": Toggles the distortion effect for this sound. Dynamic mode only.

"PitchMult": Pitch multiplier. Works by stretching the sound's length. Ranges between 0.25-4.0.

"MuffleInfluence": Effectiveness of muffle effects. Lower values mean less affected.

"KeywordExclusions": Sounds that contain the provided Keyword but are ignored. For example, the Keyword "shot" registers sounds called "gunshot" but can also register sounds you wouldn't want gunshot values applied to, like "tasershot". To avoid this overlap without using a more specific Keyword, you would place "tasershot" in this list. Case insensitive. Custom sound values from [modname]. Takes override priority over the standard "Custom Sounds" list. This list is not synced with other players. If you edit the items in this list, the changes will apply locally but they will not be saved outside of the session. If you have issues with the contents of this list, please take it up with the mod author.
Ignored Sounds Sounds in this list are ignored by all processing except volume
Water Surface Ignored Sounds Sounds in this list pass through air-water barriers unobstructed
Water Body Ignored Sounds Sounds in this list pass through water bodies unobstructed. Does not affect how sounds interact with water surfaces
Wall Propagating Sounds Sounds in ths list are able to jump into nearby hulls to better reach the player, receiving a "Thin Wall" obstruction instead of a "Thick Wall"
Pitch Ignored Sounds Sounds in this list are unable to be pitched
Reverb Forced Sounds Exclusive to the "Dynamic" and "Static" effect modes. Sounds in this list will always receive the reverb effect if possible
Air Reverb Ignored Sounds Exclusive to the "Dynamic" and "Static" effect modes. Sounds in this list never receive the reverb effect
Water Reverb Ignored Sounds Exclusive to the "Dynamic" effect mode. Sounds in this list never receive the reverb effect
Barrier Ignored Sounds Sounds in this list are unable to be muffled by occlusion, walls, doors, or water surfaces
XML Ignored Sounds+ This list is intended for sounds marked internally with the "dontmuffle" tag or similar properties. Sounds in this list will always be evaluated for muffling.
Lowpass Ignored Sounds Sounds in this list will never receive muffle effects
Container Ignored Sounds Sounds in this list pass through any containers that they're stored in unobstructed
Drowning Exempt Players Insert player names in this list to grant them immunity from the drowning bubbles effect caused by speaking without a suit underwater
modified settings - the server config has been updated disabled setting synchronization - local configs now take priority Monitor Hydrophones The active server config has [count] changes from your local config: Listening... Loading audio buffers... Invalid Input Enabled Disabled Default Vanilla Custom Linear Instant Per Tick Concave Convex s Reset Reset All
Welcome to Soundproof Walls 2.0 Soundproof Walls 2.0 is a fully rewritten and expanded version of the original mod and stands as a complete audio system overhaul for Barotrauma.
Major Changes
• Environmentally Simulated Reverb Sounds and player voices echo realistically based on the size and volume of the room. Outside the submarine, loud sounds can be heard echoing for miles as the soundwaves bounce off the icy surface of Europa.
• Sidechain Compression System Sounds like gunshots or explosions are louder and more impactful. This new dynamic range creates a feeling of power behind every shot as quieter sounds are left behind.
• Dynamic Lowpass Frequency Sounds are no longer limited to being muffled at one set strength and will now dynamically adapt based on the situation and how many obstructions are in the way.
• Sound Occlusion Sounds are muffled by the shape of the surrounding level geometry as they explore their path to the player's ears.
• Powerful Distortion Gunshots, explosions, and other loud sounds distort violently. By default this effect is subtle, but I wouldn't recommend increasing the distortion gain too high.
• Better Voice Chat Choose how clear your radio sounds with the custom radio filter or try out the new local voice system that dynamically adjusts how far your voice travels based on how loud you're yelling.
• Overhauled Systems The eavesdropping and hydrophone systems from 1.0 have received a full makeover with new visuals and sound effects. Vanilla systems have also been improved, with water flow sounds finally being muffled by walls and a key fix for sounds occasionally not playing.
• Absolute Control With 150+ new config options and a brand new settings menu, you have complete control over the properties and effects of every individual sound, allowing for many unique configurations
I hope you enjoy the changes! Let me know if you have any questions or issues :) - Plag
This is just the surface Support me Check out the code See the full changelog on Steam! Buy me a coffee on KoFi! Give the repo a star on GitHub!
Settings
Soundproof Walls Statistics: You've initialized Soundproof Walls [initcount] times.
And played for [playtime] with the mod enabled.
[percenteavesdrop]% of your time is spent eavesdropping.
And [percenthydrophone]% of your time is spent monitoring the hydrophones.
In total, [soundcount] sounds have been processed by Soundproof Walls.
